sub_title: Business Unit Leader at Mentor Worldwide LLC
summary:
I consider myself as a generalist, an influential and articulate individual with tremendous drive to inspire and lead people. I am able to implement and sustain processes while also focusing on continuous improvements with the means of root cause problem solving, listening and engaging people. 

I am able to adjust and learn quickly in new and unknown areas. In a short span on time I have worked in different departments with multiple disciplinary and cross functional teams, with increased responsibilities. I am known for someone who get things done.

certifications.name: Certified Lean Six Sigma Green Belt
Safety for Operational Supervisors VCA VOL

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for end to end Mentor Leiden operations.

Overseeing >400 FTE within daily production as well process engineering groups, ensuring commitment to our customers with safety and quality mindset.
profile_positions.title: Business Unit Leader

profile_positions.description:
Leading the department of Environment, Health, Safety and Sustainability for Mentor Leiden as one of the members for Site Leadership Team. Responsible for the health and safety of >= 500 employees. 

Ensuring that the EHS&S management system is in compliance with internal J&J standards and external IOS 14001. In this role I am SPOC for Mentor with notified bodies in relation to EHS&S. 

I am also designated as prevention employee (pventiemedewerker) for the site and head of the ERT (emergency response team). Apart from this I am also sponsor/leading the safety culture improvement project where EHS&S compliance is owned by all employees. 

Within this position I have to engage with multi disciplinary teams, working with cross functional groups, and monthly reporting to EHS&S executive management for my site. This has led to not only working on the short/mid term items, but also working on the strategy for long term sustainability.

Additionally due to Covid-19 pandemic, I am also leading the CMT (crisis management team) for the site, where we ensure mitigations are in place by implementing all the counter measures as per the guidelines by J&J and RIVM.
profile_positions.title: Environment, Health and Safety Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the daily management of the activities of the maintenance & calibration department, leading a team of >= 15 FTE's. Translating the business goals into maintenance goals, reaching mutual agreements with operations department on the (OEE) overall equipment effectiveness which measures the capacity losses related to quality, uptime and performance.

I was also leading IOSS (integrated ownership of safety standards) for permit to work, lock out tag out, confined space, hot work, and contractor management. Under my leadership we leveraged the procedures from J&J corporate and defined them for internal site use. This ensured all activities are carried out in accordance with appropriate internal and external health, safety & environment procedures, safe working conditions and practices, and supporting documents in place. 

I also acted as subject matter expert on maintenance, calibration and validation related activities during internal and external audits. In addition to this I was also leading/supporting the timely closure of NC / CAPA's. 

In this role I also successfully certified as Leen Green Belt (Manufacturing/Process Engineering Excellence J&J) by executing the project for Site Asset Management. Based on the execution, site was able to achieve around 70% reduction in MTTR (Mean Time to Repair) and overall uptime for Machinery on avg. was >= 85%. This was achieved by applying Leen principals, empowering my team; we went on to perform site machine criticality assessment, procure the critical spares, set up asset database, organized the asset store (6s) and set up SLA's (service level agreements) with critical suppliers.
profile_positions.title: Supervisor Maintenance & Calibration

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the optimization of the production process by increasing the reliability of the equipment and process. Facilitate process improvement activities using Lean and other continuous process improvement strategies. Lead yield improvement projects resulting in cost effectiveness.

Providing technical improvements through data analysis and management systems. Analyzing and improving preventive maintenance plans, and spare parts management using RCM (Reliability Centered Maintenance) approach. 

Supporting validation activities by providing analysis, authoring protocols (SAT, FAT, IQ, OQ, PQ & PV), data analysis, final report preparation for equipment, processes and instrumentation. 

Lead audit observations, corrective and preventive action tasks (CAPA), non conformance (NC) due to process deviation by performing investigation, root cause analysis, and effectiveness monitoring.

Actively participating within cross functional teams to determine the root cause and corrective actions for problems associated with investigations. Ensuring effective communication and alignment in coordination with appropriate teams.

In addition to responsibilities of a Process (Line) Engineer, also acting as Site Machine Safety Lead. 
Establish, implement, and maintain a process for conducting risk assessment, using WRAPS, to determine conformance with J&J Machine Safety philosophy. Provide Machine Safety training to machinery/equipment operators, maintenance and supervisory personnel. Monthly update to CSS (Cardiovascular & Specialty Solutions) EHS&S Leadership board over site performance regarding HRN (Hazard Rating Number) reduction.
profile_positions.title: Process (Line) Engineer (Shell Fabrication Plant)

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for providing technical expertise on all matters of reliability engineering, assessment and monitoring for all process equipment (including mechanical, electrical and instrument / control equipment), carrying out reliability studies on existing equipment and recommending needed improvements to management using RCM (Reliability Centered Maintenance) approach.

Responsible for implementing activities to maximize the maintenance related up-time and operating efficiency of equipment and facility assets. These activities help minimize costs and contribute to the profitability and performance of the business.

Supporting validation activities by providing analysis, authoring protocols (SAT, FAT, IQ, OQ, PQ & PV), data analysis, final report preparation for equipment, processes and instrumentation. 

Actively participating within cross functional teams to determine the root cause and corrective actions for problems associated with investigations. Ensuring effective communication and alignment in coordination with appropriate teams.
profile_positions.title: Reliability Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Asset Management (preparing the list of spare parts currently in stock)
Performing the site criticality assessment (equipment) based
Performing the RCM (Reliability Centered Maintenance) analysis for the top most 20 critical equipment 
Maintenance Management using Maximo
Preparing and updating RCM related trainings and assigning them to different specific involved people
profile_positions.title: Manufacturing Excellence & Maintenance Engineer (Graduate Intern)

profile_positions.description:
Videtur B.V. is  a  start-up  company  that  desires  to  help  patients  or  people  with  hearing problems. They want to make a hearing aid prototype with a smart phone. Nowadays, smart phones have a lot of capacity for making calculations in particular to improving the functionality of the hearing aid. Therefore, it is good to investigate the possibilities.

As part of IPD program from Fontys University of Applied Sciences, I worked on this project leading a team of 6 Engineers. Together as a team, we build a Hardware Prototype for a Mobile USB Audio Device.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader

profile_positions.description:
USB 2.0 chip validation

The assignment focused on understanding for how the USB 2.0 works and how it can be made in such a way that the BER (bit error rate) setup gets automated. In that way, we can save plenty of our time.
profile_positions.title: Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Raising money for the flood affected people of Pakistan
